result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orrin L Smith

records.addlTxt: Defn accepted into FOP; contract terminates March 2, 2023

ADDRESS INFO for Orrin L Smith
Current: 2232 W Broadway, Madison, WI 53713 United States  (Effective: 06-29-2022)
Prior: 1934 Wyoming Ave, Sun Prairie, WI 53590

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards anyone.

Defendant appeared.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend no contact to no acts/threats and to remove the address ban. State in 950 compliance with this request. Court amends no contact with victim or her residence to no acts/threats of violence towards anyone. Court removes address ban. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

Defendant appeared.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court has colloquy with DE in regards to an attorney. DE waives right to an attorney. Court accepts waiver. Jt: plea ct 1. DISM ct 2. FOP referral. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty. Court accepted def's plea but w/h adjudication and referred def to FOP. Court DISM ct 2. Bail continued  File Review scheduled for October 3, 2022.
Bail/bond hearing on June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant appeared.  Patrick Winter for Will Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties request plea date.
State's request for bond hearing based on alleged victim's request to address Court on topic of bond
Pre-trial conference on June 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Elizabeth S. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 1900 block of Wyoming Ave in Sun Prairie. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

01:33 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
